choices.label: It has a higher percent ionization, a lower <math alttext="the equilibrium molar concentration of H 3 O with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, and a lower <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than a <math alttext="0.150 molar H C O O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.150</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCOOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> solution does.
